newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine's Kuchma names new chief-of-staff.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine's Kuchma names new chief-of-staff.

text.p: President Leonid Kuchma on Friday appointed Yevhen Kushnaryov, mayor of Ukraine's second biggest city, to head his administration, a presidential spokesman told Reuters.
Kushnaryov, 45, will replace Dmytro Tabachnyk who was sacked 10 days ago.
Kushnaryov, mayor of Kharkiv in eastern Ukraine, is a senior member of the pro-presidential Peoples' Democratic Party, which mostly consists of top local officials.
Kuchma restructured his administration this week, making his chief-of-staff and four of his deputies report to him directly.
The move seemed designed to silence critics who said Tabachnyk had too much influence -- local media referred to him as "the president's shadow".
Kuchma also subordinated four key ministers -- foreign, defence, interior and information -- directly to him instead of to Prime Minister Pavlo Lazarenko.
Kuchma's aides, seeking to justify the move, described him as the "symbol of the nation" and its "highest judge".
